item.title: Quick & Easy Homemade Butter Chicken
item.description: Savor the rich, creamy flavors of butter chicken made right in your kitchen! This easy recipe is perfect for meal prep and pairs beautifully with naan or rice. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 4 | #cat1761230383494 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound chicken, cut into bite-sized pieces
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 1 onion, finely chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tablespoon ginger, grated
  • 1 can (15 oz) tomato sauce
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 2 teaspoons garam masala
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
  2. Add onion, garlic, and ginger; sauté until onion is translucent.
  3. Stir in chicken pieces and cook until browned on all sides.
  4. Add tomato sauce, heavy cream, garam masala, cumin, salt, and pepper; simmer for 20 minutes.
  5. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound sausage, crumbled
  • 4 large eggs
  • 1 package refrigerated crescent roll dough
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tablespoon chopped chives (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
  2. In a skillet over medium heat, cook the crumbled sausage until browned.
  3. In a bowl, whisk the eggs and season with salt and pepper.
  4. Add the eggs to the skillet with the sausage and scramble until fully cooked.
  5. Unroll the crescent roll dough and separate it into triangles.
  6. Place a spoonful of the sausage and egg mixture at the wide end of each triangle.
  7. Roll up the dough, starting from the wide end, and place on a baking sheet.
  8. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 15 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 30 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 1

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 slices of bread
  • 1 egg
  • 2 slices of ham
  • 1 slice of cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Butter for cooking

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add a little butter.
  2. Crack the egg into the skillet and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the white is set and the yolk is cooked to your liking.
  3. While the egg is cooking, toast the bread in another skillet or toaster.
  4. Once the egg is done, place the ham slices in the skillet to warm them up.
  5. Assemble the sandwich by placing the cheese on one slice of bread, followed by the ham, the cooked egg, and then the other slice of bread.

⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 2

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 slices of bread
  • 1 cup homemade baked beans
  • 2 tomatoes, halved
  • 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
  • 2 sausages
  • 2 eggs

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Toast the bread until golden brown.
  2. In a skillet, cook the sausages over medium heat until browned.
  3. Add the mushrooms and tomatoes to the skillet, cooking until softened.
  4. Heat the baked beans in a small pot until warmed through.
  5. Fry the eggs to your liking in a separate pan.
  6. Serve everything on a plate, arranging it for a colorful presentation.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound chicken breast, diced
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 cup cream cheese
  • 1/2 cup jalapeños, diced
  • 1 cup chicken broth
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
  2. Add diced chicken and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Cook until browned.
  3. Stir in jalapeños and cook for another 2 minutes.
  4. Add cream cheese and chicken broth, stirring until creamy and well combined.
  5. Simmer for 5-10 minutes until the sauce thickens.
  6. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 8 ounces pasta of your choice
  • 1 pound smoked sausage, sliced
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
  2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced smoked sausage and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
  3. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Mix until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.
  4. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups shredded cooked chicken
  • 1 cup enchilada sauce
  • 1 cup shredded cheese
  • 8 corn tortillas
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat and add shredded chicken, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Stir until heated through.
  3. Spread a thin layer of enchilada sauce on the bottom of a baking dish.
  4. Fill each tortilla with the chicken mixture and a sprinkle of cheese, then roll them up and place seam-side down in the baking dish.
  5. Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the top and sprinkle with the remaining cheese.
  6. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and golden.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
  • 4 slices of ham
  • 4 slices of Swiss cheese
  • 1 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1/2 cup heavy cream
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
  2. Flatten the chicken breasts to an even thickness using a meat mallet.
  3. Layer each chicken breast with a slice of ham and a slice of cheese.
  4. Roll the chicken tightly and secure with toothpicks.
  5. Dip each chicken roll in heavy cream and then coat with breadcrumbs.
  6. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear the chicken rolls until golden brown on all sides.
  7. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 20 minutes or until cooked through.
  8. Remove toothpicks before serving.

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound broccoli florets
  • 8 ounces pasta of your choice
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Parmesan cheese for serving

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the pasta according to package instructions.
  2. In the last 3 minutes of cooking, add the broccoli florets to the pot.
  3. Drain the pasta and broccoli, reserving a cup of pasta water.
  4. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat and sauté the minced garlic until fragrant.
  5. Add the drained pasta and broccoli to the skillet, tossing to combine. If needed, add reserved pasta water to reach desired consistency.
  6. Season with salt and pepper, and serve with grated Parmesan cheese.

It's not only easy to make but also packed with fiber and protein, making it the perfect choice for busy mornings or a cozy weekend breakfast. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230422512 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 6

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups rolled oats
  • 2 apples, diced
  • 1 teaspoon cinnamon
  • 2 cups almond milk
  • 1/4 cup honey or maple syrup
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a large bowl, combine oats, diced apples, cinnamon, and salt.
  3. In another bowl, mix almond milk and honey or maple syrup.
  4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
  5. Transfer the mixture to a greased baking dish and sprinkle with chopped nuts if using.
  6. Bake for 30 minutes or until the top is golden and the oats are set.

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pie crust
  • 6 large eggs
  • 1 cup milk
  • 1 cup shredded cheese
  • 1 cup chopped vegetables (like spinach, bell peppers, or onions)
  • 1 cup cooked meat (like bacon, sausage, or ham)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
  2. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and milk until well combined.
  3. Stir in the cheese, vegetables, meat, salt, and pepper.
  4. Pour the egg mixture into the pie crust.
  5. Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the quiche is set and lightly golden on top.
  6. Allow to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 120 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 10 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 130 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 3 1/2 cups flour
  • 1/4 cup sugar
  • 2 1/4 tsp active dry yeast
  • 3/4 cup warm milk
  • 2 eggs
  • 1/4 cup butter, melted
  • Jelly or jam for filling
  • Powdered sugar for dusting
  • Oil for frying

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Mix yeast with warm milk and sugar, let foam for 10 minutes.
  2. Add flour, eggs, and melted butter; knead until smooth.
  3. Let dough rise for 1 hour until doubled in size.
  4. Roll out dough and cut into circles; let rise for another 30 minutes.
  5. Deep fry at 350°F (175°C) until golden, about 2-3 minutes per side.
  6. Cool, then inject with jelly using a piping bag.
  7. Dust generously with powdered sugar before serving.

item.title: Chili Colorado
item.description: Experience the rich and vibrant flavors of traditional Mexican Chili Colorado, a hearty dish that brings warmth and comfort to any table. This slow-cooked delight features tender beef simmered in a luscious red chili sauce, perfect for sharing with family and friends. | ⏱️ Prep: 25min | Cook: 40min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761229889885 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 25 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 40 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 65 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 6 ancho chili peppers, stemmed and seeded
  • 6 guajillo peppers, stemmed and seeded
  • 2 pasilla peppers, stemmed and seeded
  • 3 chiles de arbol, stemmed and seeded
  • 1 tablespoon Mexican oregano
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 small onion, chopped
  • 2 jalapeno peppers, chopped (optional)
  • 4-5 cloves garlic, chopped
  • 2.5 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into bite-sized chunks
  • ¼ cup flour
  • 2 cups beef stock
  • Crumbly white cheese, fresh herbs, spicy chili flakes, lime juice for serving
  • Rice and/or warmed tortillas for serving

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Make the sauce first by dry toasting the dried peppers in a pan for about a minute per side, until the skins blister a bit. Set them into a bowl and cover with hot water for 20 minutes, until they are very soft.
  2. Transfer the peppers to a blender with oregano, cumin, a bit of salt and pepper, and 1 cup of the soaking water. Blend until nice and smooth. Strain the sauce and set aside.
  3. Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Toss the cubed chuck roast in the flour with a bit of salt and pepper to coat them. Brown the beef on all sides, about 5 minutes. Remove to a plate and set aside.
  4. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the onion and peppers and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
  5. Add the red chili sauce and stock to the pot and bring to a boil. Add the browned meat back to the pot. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes to let the flavors develop. For melt-in-your-mouth tender beef, simmer for 2 hours or more.
  6. If you’d like to thicken the chili, remove the cover and increase the heat. Cook until the moisture cooks out and your preferred thickness is achieved.

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 pounds beef chuck roast, shredded
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 onion, diced
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 cans diced tomatoes
  • 2 cans kidney beans, drained
  • 2 tablespoons chili powder
  • 1 tablespoon cumin
  • 1 cup beef broth
  • 1/2 cup Masa Harina
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.
  2. Add the shredded beef and cook until browned.
  3. Stir in diced tomatoes, kidney beans, chili powder, cumin, and beef broth. Bring to a simmer.
  4. Cover and let simmer for 8 hours, stirring occasionally.
  5. In the last hour, mix Masa Harina with a little water to create a slurry and stir it into the chili to thicken.
  6. Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 240 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 0 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 240 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 16

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups mixed dried fruits
  • 1 cup unsalted butter
  • 1 cup brown sugar
  • 4 large eggs
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
  • 1/2 cup brandy

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C).
  2. In a bowl, soak the mixed dried fruits in brandy for at least 4 hours or overnight.
  3. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
  4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
  5. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
  6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
  7. Fold in the soaked fruits and any remaining brandy.
  8. Pour the batter into a greased cake pan and smooth the top.
  9. Bake for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  10. Let the cake cool completely before serving.

item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 15 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 30 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 36

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1 teaspoon peppermint extract
  • 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • Red and green food coloring
  • Powdered sugar for dusting

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Beat in the egg, vanilla extract, and peppermint extract until well combined.
  4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until a dough forms.
  6. Divide the dough in half. Color one half with red food coloring and leave the other half plain.
  7. Roll out small pieces of each color into long ropes, then twist them together to form a candy cane shape.
  8. Place the cookies on the prepared baking sheets and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until lightly golden.
  9. Allow to cool on a wire rack and dust with powdered sugar before serving.

  • 1/4 cup Dijon mustard
  • Cloves
  • Pineapple rings

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C).
  2. Score the ham in a diamond pattern, making shallow cuts across the surface.
  3. Stud the ham with cloves, placing them in the intersections of the diamond pattern.
  4. In a bowl, mix together the honey, brown sugar, and Dijon mustard until well combined.
  5. Brush the glaze generously over the ham, ensuring it gets into the scored cuts.
  6. Place the ham in a roasting pan and bake for 2 hours, basting frequently with the remaining glaze.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 40 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 60 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 100 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 22

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups powdered sugar
  • 1 cup almond flour
  • 3 large egg whites
  • 1/4 cup granulated sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Red and white food coloring
  • Buttercream or ganache for filling

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 300°F (150°C) and line baking sheets with parchment paper.
  2. In a bowl, sift together powdered sugar and almond flour.
  3. In a separate bowl, whip egg whites until foamy, then gradually add granulated sugar until stiff peaks form.
  4. Gently fold in the almond flour mixture and vanilla extract until combined.
  5. Divide the batter into two bowls, tint one red and leave the other white.
  6. Transfer the mixtures into piping bags and pipe small circles onto the prepared baking sheets.
  7. Let the macarons sit for 30 minutes to form a skin, then bake for 15-20 minutes.
  8. Allow to cool completely before filling with buttercream or ganache.

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon baking soda
  • 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 1/2 cups white sugar
  • 1 egg
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/2 teaspoon almond extract
  • 3/4 cup colored sugar for decoration

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
  2. In a small bowl, stir together flour, baking soda, and baking powder.
  3. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until smooth.
  4. Beat in the egg, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
  5. Gradually blend in the dry ingredients.
  6. Roll rounded teaspoonfuls of dough into balls, and place onto ungreased cookie sheets.
  7. Flatten each ball with the bottom of a glass, and sprinkle with colored sugar.
  8. Bake 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden.
  9. Let cool on wire racks.

🍽️ Servings: 14

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1/2 cup powdered sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 cup raspberry jam

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a large bowl, cream together the softened butter and powdered sugar until light and fluffy.
  3. Mix in the vanilla extract and salt.
  4. Gradually add the flour, mixing until a dough forms.
  5. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to about 1/4 inch thick.
  6. Cut out shapes using a cookie cutter, and cut out a smaller shape in the center of half of the cookies.
  7. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly golden.
  8. Let the cookies cool completely before spreading raspberry jam on the solid cookies and topping with the cut-out cookies.

  5. Combine cooked pasta with the chicken and sauce, mixing well to coat.

item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 90 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 105 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 6

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup wild rice
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and diced
  • 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried sage
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
  2. Add butternut squash and mushrooms, cooking for about 5 minutes until they begin to soften.
  3. Stir in wild rice, vegetable broth, thyme, sage, salt, and pepper.
  4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 1 hour, or until rice is tender.
  5. Adjust seasoning as needed and serve warm.
